qas.question: What was the name of the project introduced by GE at the 2011 Toronto International Fils Festival?
Which company was GE's partner in the Short Fils, Big Ideas project?
What type of system is Sligshot?
What prize was awarded to the winning amateur dirctor film at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival?
How many online views did the Short Films, Big Ideas campaign generate?
How much did it cost to produce the movie, "The Cyborg Foundation"?
In what year was the first Sundance Film Festival held?
In what year was cinelan founded?
How many people saw the movie, "The Cyborg Foundation", at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival?
In what city is the Tribeca Film Festival held?

context: <a0_0>Short Films, Big Ideas<a0_0/> was launched at the <b7_0>2011<b7_0/> <b9_0>Toronto<b9_0/> International Film Festival in partnership with <a1_0>cinelan<a1_0/>. Stories included breakthroughs in Slingshot (<a2_0>water vapor distillation<a2_0/> system), cancer research, energy production, pain management and food access. Each of the 30 films received world premiere screenings at a major international film festival, including the Sundance Film Festival and the Tribeca Film Festival. The winning amateur director film, The Cyborg Foundation, was awarded a <a3_0><b5_0>US$100,000<b5_0/><a3_0/> prize at the <b6_0>2013<b6_0/> at Sundance Film Festival.[citation needed] According to GE, the campaign garnered more than <b8_0>1.5 billion<b8_0/> total media impressions, <a4_0>14 million<a4_0/> online views, and was seen in 156 countries.[citation needed]
